Package ui.input.selection

Class DrawableSelectableBufferedSection<T extends BufferedSection>

  • java.lang.Object
    • ui.drawing.DrawableSection
      • ui.input.selection.DrawableSelectableSection
        • ui.input.selection.DrawableSelectableBufferedSection<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - The type of underlying buffered section to use.
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    BufferedSection, PrintHandler, Section, SelectableBufferedSection, SelectableSection, SelectionHandler
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    GameBoard.PromotionIndicator, Piece, TextBox
    public abstract class DrawableSelectableBufferedSection<T extends BufferedSection>
extends DrawableSelectableSection
implements SelectableBufferedSection
    Represents a drawable selectable buffered section.
    Represents a selectable section that can be drawn to the terminal window.
    Represents a section that can be drawn to the terminal window.

        section - The underlying buffered section.
        enabled - Boolean; true if section is enabled for selection.
        terminalHandler - The TerminalHandler object.
        escapeHandler - The escape handler to use when escape is pressed.
        horizontal - Boolean; true if the primary direction is horizontal.

    • Method Detail

      • getRow

        public void getRow​(ColouredStringBuilder builder,
                   int row,
                   int startCol,
                   int maxCols)
        Generates a single line of the section to be written to the terminal. In this case pass to the underlying buffered section.
        Specified by:
        getRow in interface Section
        Parameters:
        builder - ColouredStringBuilder to handle ANSI colour coding in the most efficient manner.
        row - Which row of the section to generate.
        startCol - The column of the section to start at.
        maxCols - The max number of columns to draw.
